org.gwt.mosaic.ui.client.table
Class TableModelEvent

java.lang.Object
  java.util.EventObject
      org.gwt.mosaic.ui.client.table.TableModelEvent
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class TableModelEvent
extends java.util.EventObject

TableModelEvent is used to notify listeners that a table model has changed.

Author:
georgopoulos.georgios(at)gmail.com
See Also:
TableModel, Serialized Form

          The event type.

source
 
Constructor Summary
TableModelEvent(TableModel source)
          All row data changed, listeners should discard any state that was based on the rows and requery the TableModel.
TableModelEvent(TableModel source, int row)
          This row of data has been updated.
TableModelEvent(TableModel source, int firstRow, int lastRow)
          The data in rows [firstRow, lastRow] have been updated.
TableModelEvent(TableModel source, int firstRow, int lastRow, int column)
          The cells in column column in the range [firstRow, lastRow] have been updated.
TableModelEvent(TableModel source, int firstRow, int lastRow, int column, TableModelEvent.Type type)
          The cells from (firstRow, column) to (lastRow, column) have been changed.

Constructor Detail

TableModelEvent

public TableModelEvent(TableModel source)
All row data changed, listeners should discard any state that was based on the rows and requery the TableModel.

Note: The structure of the TableModel ie, the column names, types and order have not changed.

Parameters:
source -

TableModelEvent

public TableModelEvent(TableModel source,
                       int row)
This row of data has been updated.

Note: To denote the arrival of a completely new table structure use ALL_ROWS as the row value.

Parameters:
source -
row -

Method Detail

getFirstRow

public int getFirstRow()
Returns the first row that changed. ALL_ROWS means table structure change.

Returns:
the first row that changed

getLastRow

public int getLastRow()
Returns the last row that changed.

Returns:
the last row that changed

getColumn

public int getColumn()
Returns the column data column. ALL_COLUMNS means every column in the specified rows changed.

Returns:
the data column

getType

public TableModelEvent.Type getType()
Returns the TableModelEvent.Type of the event.

the event type
